abilities.description: Creates ghost-like entities that pass through targets and cause extreme depression and negativity, making victims lose the will to fight or live.
abilities.limitations: Ineffective against people who are already extremely negative, as demonstrated by Usopp.

abilities.description: An enhanced version of Negative Hollow where Perona summons four ghosts simultaneously to attack a target with intensified depression-inducing power.
abilities.limitations: Still ineffective against naturally negative individuals like Usopp.

keyMoments.title: Quadruple Negative Attack Debut
keyMoments.description: Perona debuts her enhanced Quadruple Negative Attack, summoning four Negative Hollows simultaneously against Usopp.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of Perona's enhanced technique, though it proves ineffective against Usopp's natural negativity.

keyMoments.title: Weakness Discovered
keyMoments.description: The Horo Horo no Mi's Negative Hollows are revealed to be completely ineffective against people who are already extremely negative, with Usopp's pessimism actually affecting the ghosts themselves.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes a critical weakness of the fruit's primary ability and shows that every Devil Fruit power has limitations.

weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weakness to seawater and Seastone
Negative Hollows are ineffective against naturally pessimistic individuals
Users with extreme negativity can actually affect the ghosts themselves
trivia: The Horo Horo no Mi is one of the few Devil Fruits shown to have a direct counter based on personality traits rather than physical abilities or other powers.
